title: Thirring Model in Lower Dimensions: Nonperturbative Approaches
abstract: A reformulation of the Thirring model as a gauge theory on both continuum spacetime and discretized lattice is reviewed. In (1+1) dimensions, our result reproduces consistently the bosonization of the massless Thirring model. In (2+1) dimensions, the analysis by use of Schwinger-Dyson equation is shown to exhibit dynamical fermion mass generation when the number $N$ of four-component fermions is less than the critical value $N_{cr}= 128/3\pi^{2}$.
